definition: to run this way and that (idiom); to rush about busily/to bustle about
east/host (i.e. sitting on east side of guest)/landlord
surname Dong
to go to/to head for/towards
to hurry/to rush/to run quickly/to elope
the West/abbr. for Spain 西班牙[Xi1 ban1 ya2]/Spanish
west
(of an animal) to paw (the ground)
to run/to run away/to escape/to run around (on errands etc)/(of a gas or liquid) to leak or evaporate/(verb complement) away/off

sentences.english: The children were tearing around in the park.
sentences.chinese: 孩子們在公園裏東奔西跑。

sentences.english: I was exhausted after buzzing around for a whole day.
sentences.chinese: 一整天東奔西跑的，把我累壞了。

sentences.english: The boy was running around with a chip on his shoulder.
sentences.chinese: 這男孩東奔西跑，到處遊逛，擺出一副好鬥的姿態。

sentences.english: The general manager has been batting around all day talking with every guest.
sentences.chinese: 總經理整天東奔西跑，與每位賓客談話。

sentences.english: I don't feel energetic enough to rush about, so I'll sit down.
sentences.chinese: 我感到沒有力氣東奔西跑，所以要坐下來。

sentences.english: Those who couldn’t afford to would run around to other factories looking for work.
sentences.chinese: 那些無以爲繼的，就東奔西跑地到別的工廠找工作。

sentences.english: Aircraft in the field love to run around, worked up quickly, but can not relax.
sentences.chinese: 飛機在情場中東奔西跑，動情快，但也放不開。

sentences.english: The best part of his job is all the travel it includes.
sentences.chinese: 他的工作大部分是東奔西跑，到處出差。

definition: lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
smile spread across the face (idiom); beaming with pleasure/all smiles/joy written across one's face
(to act) on one's own initiative
red in the face/extremely angry
to die (idiom)/to breathe one's last/to give up the ghost
it's the most capable people who do the most work (idiom) (intended as consolation for the overworked, or flattery when making a request etc)
to think for oneself and act accordingly (idiom); to act on one's own initiative
see 驢唇不對馬嘴|驴唇不对马嘴[lu:2 chun2 bu4 dui4 ma3 zui3]
pinyin: niu2 tou2 bu4 dui4 ma3 zui3

definition: to concentrate on
vocal accompaniment in some traditional Chinese operas/to speak in support of/to chime in
to listen with respectful attention/(a polite request to sb to speak)/we are all ears
drinking party/to go on a binge/to paint the town red
sparkling with wit (idiom)
dejected/despondent/depressed
to have a clear view of things/to adapt to circumstances
sullen/to scowl miserably
